definition: to learn by heart/to commit to memory/to remember/to memorize in silence
silent/to write from memory
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
to devote oneself to a task in silence (idiom)

sentences.english: He knows many passages from Shakespeare by heart.
sentences.chinese: 他默記了莎士比亞的許多文句。

sentences.english: Memorization is a very concrete, basic form of thinking.
sentences.chinese: 默記是一種非常實在的基礎的思維模式。

sentences.english: He started memorizing the Quran again.
sentences.chinese: 他再次開始默記古蘭經。

definition: to stop halfway/to give up halfway/interruption/suspension
lit. bleak wind and icy rain (idiom)/fig. hardships/miserable circumstances
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
lit. seeing others go hunting, one is excited by memories of the thrill of the hunt (idiom)/fig. seeing others do what one loves to do, one is inspired to try it again

clan/race
tuning/temperament
cups and dishes in complete disorder (idiom); after a riotous drinking party

lute (loanword)
illusion (Buddhism)/pipe dream
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
